name: msf
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wcel(c0, cms), wf(c1, cxp(c2, c2), cr))

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, cms), wf(c1, cxp(c2, c2), cr), wcel(c1, cfv(cmet, c2)))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ MetSp, (c1 :(c2 × c2)→ ℝ), c1 ∈(Met ` c2))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cms), wf(c1, cxp(c2, c2), cr))

|- wi(wcel(c0, cms), wcel(c1, cfv(cmet, c2)))

body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ MetSp → c1 ∈(Met ` c2))
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c0)
⊣ c1 =((dist ` c0)|`(c2 × c2))

comment: The distance function of a metric space is a function into the real numbers. (Contributed by NM, 30-Aug-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Nov-2013.)
